page.title: 15BISHOP MIDDLEHAM SCHOOL
page.content: The school in the village is primary and has 130 children aged from 4+ to 11+ . It is a Church of England Aided School and as such is technically owned by the school Governors who are responsible for the education and any external repairs or improvements to the building. The building is semi open plan in design and has 6 classrooms and a central hall. There are at present 5 teachers and a Headteacher in charge of the education of the school. The school takes most of the children from the village and also the children from the outlying villages of Bradbury and Mordon. The children follow a broad curriculum and transfer at the age of 11+ to Sedgefield Community College.
